Message:
We found ourselves in a village
ravaged by a deadly disease,
its villagers too poor to buy
the medicine or rations to fight it.

“Aura, you’ve already
used up all your jewelry,
so there’s nothing else we can...

“If I stretch the definition
of what counts for my power...!”

As she muttered this,
she slid a knife across her palm.

With no time to stop her,
a wealth of golden light
shot forth from her hand,
enveloping the entire village
in its glow.

When the light faded,
the ailing villagers began
to rise from their sickbeds
one after another.

Her face white as a sheet,
Aura turned to face me
and flashed a smile.
Good grief...

As the drained Aura
was offered a chance to stay
until she recovered
by the villagers,
I felt myself break into a smile.

Your dream just got a little closer
to becoming reality, Aura.
